title.narrative: GOVERNMENT CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Ministry of Education at central and decentralized levels has strengthened capacities for policy development, coordination, planning, budgeting and monitoring, including in humanitarian situation, which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, children of basic and post-basic school age, especially girls, have increased and more equitable access to quality learning in a progressively strengthened education system, including in humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Ministry of Education at central and decentralized levels has strengthened capacities for policy development, coordination,planning, budgeting and monitoring, including in humanitarian situation

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated for expansion of EMIS to eight governorates in Iraq and e-Perwerde to 4,000 schools in KRG. For EMIS a rollout plan was completed in collaboration with MOE and UNESCO for the eight governorates. Initiatives to develop decentralized education sector plans and establish a learning assessment system commenced. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2019
